reviews.sentence: Great location close to transport cafes. We found this Hotel to be fantastic for our brief visit to Sydney close to lots of great restaurants the Rocks Markets on weekends and the close proximity to Circular Quay for ferries trains. Overall it helped make our stay a memorable event. Everything except we like firm beds and pillows therefore the king size beds pillows were a bit too soft. Rocks area for restaurants and great Markets on weekends. Short stroll to the Opera House area for restaurants and bars. Circular Quay for Ferries. Firmer beds and pillows.

Perfect Location. But Disappointing for a Four Seasons. When traveling to Sydney one would be fortunate to unpack at such a perfect location from which to view the Harbour and Opera House from high floors walk the area to fantastic touring venues or to generally explore that area of Sydney. The Four Seasons is grand and provides service that pleases its guests. This is certainly a grand property housekeeping management does not however seem to maintain the standards of cleanliness one may be accustomed to at other Four Seasons properties. My family stayed in two different room types both were dark and poorly lit and the bathrooms were marginally clean. The other elements of both rooms regarding cleanliness seemed ok but still not what is generally expected of a Four Seasons.

Best of Sydney. Not only should you book a harbour view room when visiting this hotel but request a high floor also. What a stunning hotel in one of the best locations in the city. A short stroll to The Rocks Circular Quay and the city centre. The foyer was opulent and the rooms also. Not overly huge but big enough to fit a huge comfortable king size bed desk and enough room for a couple of suitcases. The service from the front desk to room service from the housekeeping staff to the concierge was excellent. Try a drink at the whisky bar a dark lit jazz club type mood with a great selection of drinks and talented bar staff to match.

Ubiquitous. I have been staying in Sydney hotels regularly for many years. I usually choose the InterContinental love the top floor lounge for breakfast. This time the conference I was attending was at the Four Seasons so I stayed there. After years of staying in hotels in various cities they just blend into one homogenous mass. The FS in Sydney is one of those. Nothing memorable but then no complaints. It all works rooms good high standard of linen etc good coffee usual breakfast efficient friendly staff etc. It ’s like numerous others. But maybe that ’s the point. Maybe the fact that it ’s all so familiar and easy is why hotels like FS work.

I attended a two day conference at the Four Seasons and found everything to be as professional as expected. The staff were friendly efficient and unobtrusive and the venue met my expectations in terms of decor and the facilities provided.
Good venue for a conference with great food and service provided to the guests attending it. Will definitely consider their service again for any events in the future.

Event. Rooms were clean and luxurious. Staff very friendly and helpful. Would efiantly stay again. Love the concierge service. Went to see John Edwards great venue. Hotel close to circular quay so very convenient.

Nice hotel close to Circular quay and House. We had an evening at Opera House to celebrate a birthday and it was an easy walk to the event Friendliness of staff cleanliness room to move in foyer and great breakfast selection great location it suits us to arrive by ferry when not staying there and attending other functions maybe 24 hr menu.

Conference venue accessible accommodation. Recently visited for a conference. Excellent conference food provided. However found their bistro food very average. Recommend their accessible accommodation excellent facility and convenient. Staff at the hotel very willing and approachable particularly the valet service. Location excellent with many good eateries close at hand.
Excellent location I was there for my business meeting. Close to Circular Quay and CBD.

Great spaces location and views. I was there for 3 nights for a conference held in the hotel. Lovely room with good amenities. Really quiet and comfortable bed meant I slept very well. Could not hear the people in the rooms around me at all. Buffet breakfast amongst the best I have had anywhere. Not all of the concierge and front desk staff were good some were unhelpful and cold. Rather expensive so thankfully I was not paying.

1 night stay. We were in Sydney just for the one night to attend a function. We were put up by my husbands company so did not choose the hotel ourselves. Our flight landed way before check in time so we went to the hotel to drop our bags off. When we arrived we were told rooms were available and we could check in early. 3 hours mind youThe staff were great the whole time from check in to breakfast and when leaving. The room was adequate but the location was perfect for touring the city rocks and harbour. My only complaint would be the bed and pillows were uncomfortable.

Four by Circluar. A perfect position for views of the harbour and opera house despite present removations along George Street. Friendly staff and very comfortable rooms. There is no ballroom at present which is being upgraded.

Relaxing place to stay. The place is a comforting and the property is also very well maintained. During one of my business meeting i had happened to drop by for a short visit. The staff went all out to make sure that I had everything in order for my trip.
Beautiful hotel and great location. We were there for a conference and the facilities we are ok however the room was not setup particularly well. Other than that great venue.
I attended a morning seminar. Staff were helpful and efficient. Coffee was good enough.

Lovely experience Event Manager. I recently held a themed Gala Dinner at the Four Seasons Hotel for 290 people and while the hotel faced some serious challenges in regards to tight time frames for event turnaround they did an incredible job and were incredible hosts. The event staff I dealt with at the hotel were nothing but professional accommodating and easy to work with. The in house AV team AV Partners were also exceptional and nothing was too much trouble. I was always kept in the loop with any changes in detail including any amendments to timings in the service of meals and the food was outstanding. My only small criticisms would be that the elevators are a bit slow and when big groups and cruise ships come in they can take a long time. A few of the rooms could also use a bit of a freshen up but overall I was extremely happy with our choice of venue and would not hesitate to recommend Jacqueline and the team at the Four Seasons if looking for a professional and memorable event venue. I would also like to mention that after speaking to some of my colleagues we unanimously agreed that the beds at the Four Seasons were the most comfortable hotel beds we had ever slept in. Thank you Four Seasons. I would be happy to work with you again in the future.

Four Seasons Luxury. Great property near within walking distance to Sydney Opera House Sydney Harbour Bridge The Rocks Markets public transport many dining options retailers. The hotel meeting space is open looking into the lobby. The front desk is professional courteous. Love that they are able to exchange money per daily exchange rate. The concierge is friendly most helpful. The exclusive Lounge 32 has the highest quality of service friendliness professionalism. The rooms are comfortable adaptors provided for your travelling devices.
Venue was nice event was mediocre.

Went for a business event they provided 2 alternate menu but none of the waiter waitress asked which meal we would like to have I ended up getting the meal that I did nt like. Service could have been better.

The club around. We arrived after a very busy week before a couple of very long and difficult meetings and went up to the club room to relax. Amy greeted us and I explained that my favourite thing in the world is champagne. Unfortunately there was sparkling white wine and proseco. available which for most people would be great but for me was not what I wanted. Amy wife to magic wand and a bottle of champagne arrived we sat enjoyed and left with a big smile on her face. How fantastic the people can still in this day and age assist you. Thank you for seasons thank you Amy.

Comfortable. Attended an Awards function in the Ballroom with around 380 guests stayed in house for the event. Acomodation was very comfortable everything you would expect from a high end hotel. Rooms are not huge but if you are just there for a night or so this is not an issue. We used valet parking and the service was excellent and reasonably priced for SydneyThe staff at the Awards function were excellent friendly and efficient. The food for the event was the only disappointment. A smoked salmon starter followed by a main of either salmon or steak. I had the steak that was like shoe leather I ca n’t recall a tougher over cooked piece of meat. Other diners had similar issues. A lot of food was returned to the kitchens uneaten. To be fair on the kitchen the time between the start of the event and dinner service was lengthy these timings may not have been communicated to the kitchen. Regardless I am surprised there is not a better system for keeping meals warm rather than one that continues to cook and dry out the food. The food service was a fail for us. A shame. Happy to stay here privately the sort of problems outlined above seem to occur regularly for large events with a dinner service.
